claim: Landlock signal scoping prevents sandboxed threads from communicating within the same process.
notes: Newsletter #5 documents a fix allowing same-process threads to signal each other while keeping cross-domain signals blocked, clarifying the boundary.

claim: Wasmtime trap handling still requires host signal handlers on every platform.
notes: Wasmtime 28.0.0 added a `signals-based-traps` feature flag to disable host signal dependencies when targeting platforms without signal support.

claim: Youki has not addressed UID/GID mapping or Wasm termination issues in 2025 releases.
notes: Recent changelog entries cite UID/GID mapping tests and Wasm executor cleanup fixes, showing active maintenance in those areas.
